result.execSummary:
The defendant Marteze J. Little was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Pay DNA surcharge.
May not have contact with victim or another person wunder the age of 18 yrs.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

deft placed on probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Case is resolved. Victim rights compliance.  Amended misd. information filed.  Repeater allegation is dismissed on State's motion.  Deft pleads guilty to the charge; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 90 days KCJ consecutive to present sentence; stayed.  Deft placed on probation for one year consecutive to present sentence.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.
Co-deft case resolved today; plea hrg for this deft set for 7/20/15 @ 1:15pm per email w/Atty Michael Barth.  Copy of email sent to ADA Kraus
Plea hearing on July 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty Barth appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  Case is resolved; however, deft has to testify in co-deft case which is scheduled to commence today.  Deft will enter plea upon completion of testimony
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Atty Barth appeared on behalf of deft.  Leave on for trial for 7/13/15; however, parties report the case is settled.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Atty Barth reports the case is not resolved.  Ludwig hrg commences - during colliquey, deft decides to accept the offer.  Leave on for status on 7/13/15 @ 9am.  NOTE - FPT/Daubert hrg on co-deft cases set for 7/9/15 @ 2:30pm.  This case to be scheduled as well.  Deft will need to be produced from prison
re: scheduling

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Atty Barth appeared on behalf of deft.  Per Court, set dates for FPT/JS on all three co-defts.  NTBS.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Atty Barth appeared on behalf of deft. from DDA Graveley - following up on the order from the Court of 1/26/15 to provide an explanation of why a deft was not produced for his court hrg & whether a motion to consolidate was going to be filed with this defts Little & Hurt-Smith & Love

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Atty Michael Barth appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not produced from prison.  State admonished about not producing the deft for today's hrg.  FPT 4/2/15 @ 9:10am, JS 4/20/15 @ 9am.  NOTE - Court orders the State to file a written report w/in one week explaining why the deft was not produced for today's hrg and if the State wishes to consolidate this case along w/Euguene Love, why a motion to consolidate has not been filed.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Case not resolved.  Add'l discovery recently provided to defense counsel.  FPT set for 10/28/14 @ 1:15pm, JT 11/17/14 @ 9am along w/co-deft case (Martell Hurt-Smith).

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Michael Barth. Clerk LE. Hearing held with co-def. KPD Det. Jerald Kaiser sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Barth. Atty. Barth moves to dismiss. Court denies motion. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 8-20-14 @ 1:30pm. Bond continued.

Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Michael Barth. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Co-def.'s attorney requests to withdraw due to conflict of interest. Time limits tolled due to unavailability of co-def.'s defense counsel. For judicial economy, the preliminary hearings will be held together. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 7-10-14 @ 10:00am. Bond continued.
Atty Michael Barth
